description.en-us: CTE-Law, Public Safety, and Security Standards

competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Correction Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the correction services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the correction services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the correction services career pathway to include: officer, probation, psychology, medical, social services, food services, and gang investigators.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the correction services career pathway.
Research the history of the correction services career pathway.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the correction services career pathway to include: prison construction, digital courts, and audio/visual monitoring.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the correction services career pathway.
Describe how the careers in the correction services career pathway have evolved and impacted society from 1970’s to present.
Emergency and Fire Management Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the emergency and fire management services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the emergency and fire management services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the emergency and fire management services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the emergency and fire management services career pathway.
Research the history of the emergency and fire management services career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the emergency and fire management services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the emergency and fire management services career pathway.
Supplemental
Identify and explore careers in the Law, Public Safety & Security cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster.
Research a career in the Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster.
Describe and use communication protocols for Law, Public Safety & Security career cluster.
Define what a Mobile Data Terminal and how it is used.
Describe the different types of dispatching organizations.
Identify the correct identification of the phonetic alphabet.
Identify and use proper radio procedures for communicating.
Law Enforcement Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the law enforcement services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the law enforcement services career pathway.

Describe some of the careers available in the law enforcement services career pathway to include: law enforcement, K-9, dispatch, traffic enforcement, investigations, agriculture officer, marine patrol, and aviation officer.
Research the history of the law enforcement services career pathway.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the law enforcement services career pathway to include: FBI Academy, FLETC, and Florida Law Enforcement Academy.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the law enforcement services career pathway to include: forensics, cyber crime, and crime prevention.
Describe how the careers in the law enforcement services career pathway have evolved and impacted society from the 1970’s to present day.
Identify components of criminal investigations.
Describe some careers available in criminal investigations to include crime scene technician and crime lab technician.
Identify evidence at a crime scene.
Describe how to collect evidence at a crime scene.
Demonstrate the skills for lifting latent prints.
Participate in processing a mock crime scene.
Legal Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the legal services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the legal services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the legal services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the legal services career pathway.
Research the history of the legal services career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the legal services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the legal services career pathway.
Security and Protective Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the security and protective services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the security and protective services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the security and protective services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the security and protective services career pathway.
Research the history of the security and protective services career pathway.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the security and protective services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the security and protective services career pathway.
Describe how the careers in the security and protective services career pathway have evolved and impacted society.
